column2: ENGLISH
First I lost my eyebrows and eyelashes, then my nose deformed. People fear me and I must hide my face as to not cause hysteria among others.
column3: J’ai commencé par perdre mes sourcils et mes cils, puis mon nez s’est déformé. Je fais peur aux gens, à tel point que je dois me cacher le visage pour ne pas provoquer l’hystérie autour de moi.
column4: Erst verlor ich Augenbrauen und Wimpern, dann verformte sich meine Nase. Die Menschen fürchten mich, und ich muss mein Gesicht verbergen, um bei ihnen keine Hysterie zu erzeugen.
column6: Primero perdí las cejas y las pestañas, luego se deformó mi nariz. La gente me teme y oculto mi cara para no asustar a los demás.

column2: My face! My beautiful face!
A strange, reddish-pink rash appeared on my palms and soles not long ago along with a fever and headache. Some parts of the rash has developed abscesses and is both ugly and itchy.
column3: Il y a peu, de drôles de boutons rougeâtres sont apparus sur mes paumes et sur la plante de mes pieds accompagnés de fièvre et de maux de tête. Certains boutons se sont transformés en affreux abcès qui me démangent.
column4: Vor kurzem erschien ein seltsamer, rötlicher Ausschlag auf meinen Handflächen und Fußsohlen, zusammen mit Fieber und Kopfschmerzen. An manchen Stellen des Ausschlags erschienen hässliche und juckende Abszesse.
column6: Hace poco me salió un sarpullido en las palmas de las manos y las plantas de los pies, acompañado de fiebre y dolor de cabeza. En algunas zonas han salido feos abscesos que me pican.

column2: What is wrong with me?
[From.GetTitledFirstName]'s ill-advised activity has resulted in [From.GetHerHim] being struck in the head.
[From.GetSheHeCap] will not stir from his bed.

I am speaking in tongues, screaming obscenities at random times, most often when the priest preaches and am sometimes lying on the ground writhing in apparent pain. I seldom remember these things and people believe me to be possessed.
column3: Je souffre de crises de démence. Tout à coup, je me mets à hurler des obscénités, généralement lorsque le prêtre est en train de prêcher. Et parfois, je m’allonge par terre en me tordant de douleur. Je me souviens rarement de ces crises et les gens me croient possédé(e).
column4: Ich spreche in fremden Zungen, schreie willkürlich Obszönitäten, meistens, wenn der Priester predigt, und manchmal winde ich mich auf dem Boden in scheinbaren Schmerzen. Ich erinnere mich selten an diese Vorfälle, und die Menschen halten mich für vom Bösen besessen.
column6: Hablo en lenguas desconocidas, grito obscenidades a veces, especialmente cuando el cura predica, y caigo al suelo retorciéndome de dolor. Apenas recuerdo estas cosas y la gente cree que estoy poseso.

column2: Begone, foul demon!
Perhaps the glass is fuller than I believed it to be.
column3: La coupe est pleine, et peut-être encore plus que je ne le croyais...
column4: Vielleicht ist das Glas voller, als ich dachte.
column6: Quizá el vaso está más lleno de lo que creía.

column2: ...as long as it does not overflow
My wound has healed without a scar.
Is this the work of seid?
My ruined limb is whole again.
No, I'm not shouting at you, this is my normal speaking voice.
I am just loud.
Time enough to do it tomorrow, or maybe the next day. Don't worry about it.
I am just a procrastinator, I guess.
I always need something to do, and to always be doing something.
I am restless.
I try to make provision for any contingency.
I am a careful planner.
It's mine, you can't have it!
I am selfish.
You can count on me to continue on my path, come hell or high water.
I am constant.
One minute I'm eager to do something, then next I couldn't care less about it.
I am moody.
My precise turns of phrase and witty repartee would put Cicero and Demosthenes to shame.
I am eloquent.
My speeches have been known to put insomniacs to sleep.
I am dull and boring.
Wherever I go, I am the center of attention.
I am magnetic.
I make decisions for the strangest of reasons, or for no reason at all.
I am irrational.
Oh woe is me, nothing ever goes right, I fail at everything.
I am self-pitying.
I have a pretty good idea of what's going to happen next.
I have good intuition.
Let's buckle down and get this job done.
I am hard working.
I don't care what kind of trouble you have.
I am callous.
I hold to the highest ideals.
I have a noble spirit.
In battle, I always lead the charge.
I lead from the front.
I never charge into an unknown situation.
I am cautious.
I always try to minimize costs.
I am efficient.
I'll get that, and that, and that, and that looks nice too.
I am frivolous.
Do we really need to buy that?
I am good with money.
I stand on ceremony, we must impress.
I am pompous.
The only impression I wish to make is that I do not waste money on ceremony.
I am plain.
I hold myself to a high ethical standard.
I am idealistic.
I only care if it works.
I am practical.
I still remember that time he cheated me, I'll never forgive him.
I am resentful.
I care not who I have to destroy to get what I want.
I am ruthless
Millenarian
This person is a member of a radical offshoot sect of a messianic religion. He views his realm's leadership as corrupt and gone astray from the true path.

Shaman
This character is a Shaman, a wise and spiritual man or woman who has the ability to communicate with nature and travel to the spirit world.

Today is a very exciting day for you, because today is the day you become a [Root.GetManWoman]. You have overheard your [From.GetFatherMother] talking to [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] companions, and you know that [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] believes the time has finally come for you to ride your first horse, and take your first place at [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] side.
column3: Aujourd'hui est un grand jour pour vous, car aujourd'hui est le jour où vous devenez un(e) [Root.GetManWoman]. Vous avez entendu votre [From.GetFatherMother] parler à ses sang-coureurs et vous savez qu'[Root.Liege.GetSheHe] pense que le temps est enfin venu pour vous de monter votre premier cheval et de prendre place à ses côtés.
column6: Hoy es un día muy emocionante, porque hoy es el día en que me convierto en un [Root.GetManWoman]. Has oído a tu [From.GetFatherMother] hablando con los jinetes de sangre [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] , y sabes que [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] cree que por fin te ha llegado el momento para que montes tu primer caballo, y cabalgaras al lado de [Root.Liege.GetHerHis].

column2: I wonder what kind of horse it'll be?
column3: Je me demande quel type de cheval cela va-t-être...
column6: Me pregunto qué tipo de caballo será?

column2: selects your first horse.

The time has come for your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] to become a [From.GetManWoman] - [From.GetSheHe] is old enough to ride [From.GetHerHis] first horse, and take [From.GetHerHis] rightful place at your side in the Khanate. As [Root.GetTitle], you are expected to provide an appropriate horse from among your own collection.
column3: Le temps est venu pour votre [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] de devenir un(e) [From.GetManWoman] - [From.GetSheHe] est assez âgé pour chevaucher son premier cheval et prendre sa légitime place à vos côtés dans le khanate. En tant que [Root.GetTitle], on attend de vous que vous offriez un cheval approprié pris dans votre propre collectionn.
column6: Ha llegado la hora para que tu [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] se convierta en un [From.GetManWoman] - [From.GetSheHe] que ya es lo suficientemente mayor como para cabalgar su [From.GetHerHis] primer caballo, y tomar [From.GetHerHis] lugar que le corresponde a tu lado en el khanate. Como [Root.GetTitle], se espera que tu le proporciones un caballo apropiado de entre tu propia colección.

column2: Only the wildest stallion will do!
column3: Seul le plus sauvage des étalons fera l'affaire !
column6: Sólo le daré el semental más salvaje!

column2: A gentle mare, perfect for a young [From.GetLadLass].
column3: Une douce jument, parfait pour un(e) jeune[From.GetLadLass].
column6: Una yegua mansa, perfecto para una joven [From.GetLadLass].

column2: A fleabitten nag.

You bring [FromFrom.GetFirstName] out into the fields alone, along with the strongest and wildest stallion in your possession. At first, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] seems terrified, and once in the saddle, the stallion instantly begins to bucks and twist, but [FromFrom.GetFirstName] clings stubbornly to the reins. Finally, the horse seems to recognize its master.
column3: Vous menez [FromFrom.GetFirstName] dans la plaine puis vous lui présenté votre plus sauvage et plus puissant étalon en votre possession. Au début, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] semble terrifié et, une fois [FromFrom.GetFirstName] monté sur la selle, l'étalon se met instantanément à ruer. Mais [FromFrom.GetFirstName] s'accroche obstinément aux rênes. Finalement, le cheval finit par reconnaître son maître.
column6: Traes a [FromFrom.GetFirstName] a los campos a solas, junto con el caballo más fuerte y más salvaje en tu posesión. Al principio, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] parece aterrorizada, y una vez en la silla, el caballo comienza instantáneamente a dar sacudidas y a retorcerse, pero [FromFrom.GetFirstName] se aferra obstinadamente a las riendas. Por último, el caballo parece reconocer a su amo.

column2: Today is the proudest day of my life.
column3: Aujourd'hui est définitivement le jour où j'ai été le plus fier.
column6: Hoy es el día más orgulloso de mi vida.

column2: is thrilled.

Your [GetFromRelation] brings you out into the fields alone, along with your first horse. The mere sight of it terrifies you - it is a gigantic stallion, so wild that even your [GetFromRelation] seems to have difficulty restraining it. Still, you manage to climb into the saddle. The beast begins to buck, but you manage to cling to the reins and force it down. At last, the horse seems to accept its place beneath you.
column3: Votre [GetFromRelation] vous amène un peu plus loin dans la plaine où on vous présente votre premier cheval. Sa vue vous terrifie, il s'agit d'un gigantesque étalon, si sauvage que votre [GetFromRelation] semble avoir des difficultés à le retenir. Néanmoins vous parvenez à monter sur la selle. La bête commence à ruer dans tous les sens, mais vous réussissez à vous accrochez aux rênes. Au bout d'un moment, le cheval semble accepter votre présence sur son dos.
column6: Tu [GetFromRelation]  te lleva a los campos a solas, junto con tu primer caballo. La mera visión de él te aterroriza .Es un semental enorme, tan salvaje que incluso tu [GetFromRelation] parece tener dificultad para restringirlo. Aún así, te las arreglas para subir a la silla de montar. La bestia comienza a dar sacudidas, pero te las arreglas para aferrarte a las riendas y forzarlo ha calmarse. Por fin, el caballo parece aceptar su lugar.

column2: I'm going to show him off to my friends!
column3: Je vais aller le montrer à mes amis !
column6: Se lo voy a mostrar a mis amigos!

column2: You bring [FromFrom.GetFirstName] out into the fields alone, along with the strongest and wildest stallion in your possession. At first, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] seems terrified, and once in the saddle, the stallion instantly begins to bucks and twist. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] clings desperately to the reins, but it's not enough, and [FromFrom.GetSheHe] is flung from the saddle!
column3: Vous menez [FromFrom.GetFirstName] dans la plaine puis vous lui présentez votre plus sauvage et plus puissant étalon en votre possession. Au début, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] semble terrifié et, une fois [FromFrom.GetFirstName] monté sur la selle, l'étalon se met instantanément à ruer. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] s'accroche désespérément aux rênes mais ce n'est pas suffisant, et [FromFrom.GetSheHe] est ejecté de la selle !
column6: Traes a [FromFrom.GetFirstName] a los campos a solas, junto con el caballo más fuerte y más salvaje en tu posesión. Al principio, [FromFrom.GetSheHe]  parece aterrorizada, y una vez en la silla, el caballo comienza instantáneamente a dar sacudidas y a retorcerse. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] se aferra desesperadamente a las riendas, pero no lo suficiente, y [FromFrom.GetSheHe] se cae de la silla!

column2: [FromFrom.GetFirstName]!
is flung from the saddle!

Your [GetFromRelation] brings you out into the fields alone, along with your first horse. The mere sight of it terrifies you - it is a gigantic stallion, so wild that even your [GetFromRelation] seems to have difficulty restraining it. Still, you manage to climb into the saddle. The beast begins to buck, and you try to cling to the reins, but it's not enough, and you are thrown from the saddle!
column3: Votre [GetFromRelation] vous amène un peu plus loin dans la plaine où on vous présente votre premier cheval. Sa vue vous terrifie, il s'agit d'un gigantesque étalon, si sauvage que votre [GetFromRelation] semble avoir des difficultés à le retenir. Néanmoins vous parvenez à monter sur la selle. La bête commence à ruer dans tous les sens, et essayez de vous accrocher aux rênes, mais cela ne suffit pas et vous êtes éjecté de la selle !
column6: Tu [GetFromRelation] te lleva a los campos a solas, junto con tu primer caballo. La mera visión de él te aterroriza .Es un semental enorme, tan salvaje que incluso tu [GetFromRelation] parece tener dificultad para restringirlo. Aún así, te las arreglas para subir a la silla de montar. La bestia comienza a dar sacudidas, e intentas aferrarte a las riendas, pero no lo suficiente, y te  caes de la silla!

column2: [GetFromRelation], help!

You bring [FromFrom.GetFirstName] out into the fields alone, along with a sturdy but gentle mare, and help [FromFrom.GetHerHim] into the saddle. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] grins as the horse trots about the field, easily following the child's commands.
column3: Vous menez [FromFrom.GetFirstName] dans la plaine puis vous lui présentez une vigoureuse mais douce jument. Vous l'aidez à monter sur la selle. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] sourit tandis que la jument parcoure la plaine au trot, réagissant au moindre ordre de l'enfant.
column6: Traes a [FromFrom.GetFirstName] a los campos a solas, junto con una yegua robusta pero mansa, y ayudas a subir a [FromFrom.GetHerHim] a la silla. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] sonríe mientras la yegua trota sobre el campo, siguiendo fácilmente las ordenes del niño.

column2: Now, you are a [FromFrom.GetManWoman].
is proud.

Your [GetFromRelation] brings you out into the fields alone, along with a sturdy mare. [From.GetSheHeCap] helps you into the saddle and gives you the reins. You try, carefully, to nudge the horse, and to your great pleasure, she obeys you almost instantly! Soon, you are trotting about the fields under your [GetFromRelation]'s careful guidance..
column3: Votre [GetFromRelation] vous amène un peu plus loin dans la plaine où on vous présente votre premier cheval, une vigoureuse jument. [From.GetSheHeCap] vous aide à monter sur la selle puis vous essayez, prudemment, de donner des ordres à votre monture. A votre grand plaisir vous découvrez qu'elle répond au moindre de vos exigences. Très vite vous vous mettez à parcourir la plaine au trot, écoutant les conseils de votre [GetFromRelation]...
column6: Tu [GetFromRelation] te lleva a los campos a solas, junto con una yegua robusta. [From.GetSheHeCap] te ayuda a subir a la silla y te da las riendas. Intentas, con cuidado, controlar a la yegua, y para tu gran placer, esté te obedece casi al instante! Pronto, estás trotando sobre los campos bajo la cuidadosa atención de [GetFromRelation]

column2: Look at me! Look at me!

You bring [FromFrom.GetFirstName] out into the fields alone, along with a sturdy but gentle mare, and help [FromFrom.GetHerHim] into the saddle. At first, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] seems excited, and the horse seems cooperative, but then something goes wrong. The horse bucks unexpectedly, and [FromFrom.GetFirstName] is flung from the saddle!
column3: Vous menez [FromFrom.GetFirstName] dans la plaine puis vous lui présenté une vigoureuse mais douce jument. Vous l'aidez à monter sur la selle. Au début, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] semble tout excité(e) et joyeux(se) tandis que la jument coopère, mais cela finit par tourner mal. La jument se met soudainement à ruer et [FromFrom.GetFirstName] est éjecté(e) de sa selle !
column6: Traes a [FromFrom.GetFirstName] a los campos a solas, junto con una yegua robusta pero mansa, y ayudas a subir a la silla a  [FromFrom.GetHerHim] Al principio, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] parece emocionado, y la yegua parece obedercer, pero entonces algo va mal. La yegua empieza a dar sacudidas de forma inesperada, y [FromFrom.GetFirstName] se cae de la silla!

column2: [FromFrom.GetFirstName]!
is humiliated.

Your [GetFromRelation] brings you out into the fields alone, along with a sturdy mare. [From.GetSheHeCap] helps you into the saddle and gives you the reins. You try, carefully, to nudge the horse, and to your great pleasure, she obeys you almost instantly! You're just starting to feel confident when the horse bucks unexpectedly, and you find yourself flung from the saddle!
column3: Votre [GetFromRelation] vous amène un peu plus loin dans la plaine où on vous présente votre premier cheval, une vigoureuse jument. [From.GetSheHeCap] vous aide à monter sur la selle puis vous essayez, prudemment, de donner des ordres à votre monture. A votre grand plaisir vous découvrez qu'elle répond au moindre de vos exigences. Vous vous sentez enfin rassuré(e) lorsque la jument se met soudainement à ruer et vous êtes éjecté(e) de la selle !
column6: Tu [GetFromRelation] te lleva a los campos a solas, junto con una yegua robusta. [From.GetSheHeCap] te ayuda a subir a la silla y te da las riendas. Intentas, con cuidado, controlar a la yegua, y para tu gran placer, ella te obedece casi al instante! Estás empezando a tener confianza cuando la yegua comienza a dar sacudidas de forma inesperada, y te caes de la silla!

column2: I'm... I'm so sorry, [GetFromRelation]!
is humiliated.

Your [GetFromRelation] brings you out into the fields alone, along with one of [From.GetHerHis] horses - and for the first time in your life, you know what it feels like to be truly disappointed. The alleged 'horse' is a fleabitten nag, the oldest in your [GetFromRelation]'s possession, nothing near what a proud [Root.Culture.GetName] warrior like you deserves!
column3: Votre [GetFromRelation] vous amène un peu plus loin dans la plaine où on vous présente votre premier cheval. Pour la première fois de votre vie vous savez ce que c'est de ressentir une véritable déception. Le fameux "cheval" est un canasson souffreteux, le plus vieux que possède votre [GetFromRelation]. Très loin de ce qu'un véritable guerrier [Root.Culture.GetName] comme vous mériterait d'avoir !
column6: Tu [GetFromRelation] te lleva a los campos a solas, junto con uno de los caballos de[From.GetHerHis] y por primera vez en tu vida, sabes lo que se siente al estar realmente decepcionado. El supuesto "caballo" es un rocín fámelico, el más antiguo en el poder de [GetFromRelation] nada cerca de lo que un orgulloso guerrero [Root.Culture.GetName] como yo me merezco!

column2: This is so humiliating...

You bring your [GetFromRelation] out into the fields alone, along with one of the oldest horses in your possession. You wish you could do better, you really do, and you can feel your [GetFromRelation] judging you as you present the horse, but you know that you have to make do with what you have. Perhaps, some day, [From.GetSheHe] will be able to find a real steed.
column3: Vous menez [FromFrom.GetFirstName] dans la plaine puis vous lui présentez le plus vieux cheval qui se trouve en votre possession. Vous auriez espéré lui offrir une meilleure monture, vraiment, et vous pouvez ressentir le regard accusateur de votre [GetFromRelation] tandis que vous lui présentez la bête. Mais vous savez que vous devez faire avec ce que vous avez. Peut-être un jour sera-t-[From.GetSheHe] capable de trouver un véritable coursier.
column6: Trasladas a [GetFromRelation] a los campos a solas, junto con uno de los caballos más antiguos de tu posesión. Deseas que ojala puedieses hacerlo mejor de lo que realmente lo haces, y puedes sentir a [GetFromRelation] que juzga al caballo, pero sabes que el tiene que conformarse con lo que tiene. Tal vez, algún día, [From.GetSheHe] sea capaz de encontrar un gran semental.

column2: At least it's better than nothing.
column3: Au moins c'est mieux que rien.
column6: Por lo menos es mejor que nada.

column2: The local priests in §Y$PROVINCE$§! claim to have found a Sacred Tree, holy to the mighty [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. They seek to turn it into a holy site, but they would require a substantial investment on your part.
Sacred Tree
A Sacred Tree has been found in this province, making it a center of theological discussion.
Anything for [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
It's just a tree...
Pious Ruler
This character is known as a particularly pious ruler, being always attentive towards the needs of the faith.

The Sacred Tree in §Y$PROVINCE$§! has become quite famous among the people, with many making pilgrimages to see such a holy site. The people praise you for such pious actions, and already sacrifices have been made in your honour, great [From.GetTitledName].
Excellent!
Destroyed Sacred Tree
A tree in the province of §Y$PROVINCE$§! is called "sacred" by the heathen population. As a good ruler of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, it is your duty to destroy such an abomination!
Destroy it! Tree worship is abominable in the eyes of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]
We cannot! It must be preserved!

A holy tree in the province of §Y$PROVINCE$§! has become a center of contention among Reformists and believers of the old faith. Unfortunately, the §Y$PROVINCE$§! Tree has become a rallying point for anti-reformation propaganda, and many Reformists advise the tree be cut down.
This tree is the past, the new [Root.Religion.GetName] doctrine is the future!
We cannot! It must be preserved!
Perhaps we are wrong...

While patrolling your realm, you have encountered the burned remains of the once famous §Y$PROVINCE$§! Tree, which was burned in hopes of converting the native peoples to another faith. Now it is a hollow reminder of an old way...
The §Y$PROVINCE$§! Tree
Not so "sacred" now.

A Yaoguai must have visited me in my dreams tonight! I woke up from a terrible and confusing nightmare, so strange it must be an omen! Perhaps it is a sign that the Heavens are going to remove the divine mandate of my dynasty?
Perhaps a sorcerer can help me...
Nobody can know this! It would be the ruin of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] name!

It has not been difficult at all to find characters who practice the occult Taoist arts of astrology and magic while wandering through the streets of the temple district. As I approach a strange man who sits in one of the alleys, he says he can help me. Should I ask him for a prediction?
Go ahead.
I do not dare. My fate must remain a secret...
I will never know the meaning of the omen I had. Now I am obsessed with the thought of that my dynasty could fall at any moment...
Everything is useless, the Heavens have spoken.

After performing the necessary rites, the sorcerer continues on with the prediction. Apparently, by interpreting the stars, the signs and my dream, everything leads him to think that it is a good presage! It seems only glory and fame await the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] name!
The Heavens favour my dynasty!
The astronomer performs the rituals, and trembling with fear, reveals that what he saw was a terrible presage. Is my future is really that dark?
I shudder at the thought!
The rites take place. Looking at the stars, the sorcerer tells me that there is nothing to worry about, apparently there is no change in my foreseeable future.
Everything will go well...

Confucius says: Ignorance is the night of the mind, a night without moon or stars. If you do not know something, it does not make sense to wriggle away in the darkness for the answer, rather, make your life better through good actions With this, the sorcerer refuses start a divination ritual.
I should keep away from these superstitions!

While in the thick of battle, you feel bloodlust overtake you. Suddenly, you lose control and start recklessly charging into the enemy lines all by yourself. Somehow, you start killing scores of enemy troops with incredible skill and strength until you reach their commander.
There's nobody in this land who can stop me!
I need not to face these insects! Pull back!

As you observe the battle, you notice that one of your flanks is being broken... by a single warrior. [From.GetSheHe] is closing in to your command position, and fights like if possessed by a demon. Something in the back of your mind tells you that you shouldn't pursue [From.GetHerHim]
I shall face you, mighty warrior!
I..I...IT's [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]!!
You finally reach the enemy commander, [From.GetTitledName], and it looks like as if he's approaching you, ready for battle, but with this might, no one can stop you!
You really think you can stand against me?
As your foe's lifeless body falls, you can see the terror in the eyes of the enemy soldiers as they retreat in fear! With this might, the land will be united in no time.
Can nobody provide me with a decent challenge?
After a long and arduous duel, you defeat your mighty opponent. Your army stands in awe at your skill in defeating this fearsome foe, and troops under his command start fleeing not long afterwards...
Where did this warrior get such skill and strength from?
Held Mithraic Rituals
Held Mithraic Rituals
Refused to attend the Mithraic Rituals
Represented Mithras
Hold the Mithraic Rituals
Mithraic prayer of Defense
Mithraic prayer of Offense
Mithraic prayer of Sovereignty
Celebrate this years' rituals to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] in a sacred ceremony at the local Mithraeum.
You begin preparations for the rituals.
The deliberations begin.
Invitations have gone out to your vassals asking them to join you in the sacred Mithraic rituals.
Let us begin preparations.
Invitation to the Mithraic rituals are sent.
[From.GetTitledFirstName], your liege, has invited you to join [From.GetHerHim] in the rituals in honour of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has declined your invitation to attend the Rituals! Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has no faith in [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], and instead follows some other creed that forces him to evict from worshipping Him.

You and your vassals arrive at the local Mithraeum, and the time has come to begin the rituals in honour of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol. The Mithraeum's leading Pater starts the opening prayer: "[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], God of the Morning, our trumpets waken the wall! '[From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is above the Nations, but Thou art over all' Now as the names are answered, and the guards are marched away, [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], also a solider, give us strength for the day!" As is tradition, the cult's senior officers, the Paters, must represent the parts of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol in their feast scene... But who will receive the highest honour of representing [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] himself?
Let us decide.

You, your fellow vassals and your liege all arrive at the local Mithraeum, and the time has come to begin the rituals in honour of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol. The Mithraeum's leading Pater starts the opening prayer: "[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], God of the Morning, our trumpets waken the wall! [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is above the Nations, but Thou art over all, Now as the names are answered, and the guards are marched away, [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], also a solider, give us strength for the day!" As is tradition, the cult's senior officers, the Paters, must represent the parts of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol in their feast scene... But who will receive the highest honour of representing [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] himself?

Now that the rituals and the prayers to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol are finished, you and your vassals gather at the Mithraeum's triclinium for the great banquet the initiates have prepared!

Now that the rituals and the prayers to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol are finished,, you gather together with your liege and the rest of [From.GetHerHis] vassals at the Mithraeum's triclinium for the great banquet the initiates have prepared!

This year's rituals to honour [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol have finished, and you handshake with your vassals as is proper Mithraic custom, before they return to their homes. Most seem to agree that the Rituals were properly done in accordance to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and that the banquet was a great delight.

This year's rituals to honour [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol have finished, and the feast has come to an end. Your liege shakes hands with you and each of the vassals as is proper Mithraic custom, before you all return home. You all agree that the Rituals were properly done in accordance to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and that the banquet was a great delight..

After much deliberation, you have been chosen to represent [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] in the part [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol's banquet scene. You are clad in the same clothes [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] wears in the images: a red Phrygian cap, a red long-sleeved tunic, dark red Parthian trousers and a blue cape. You and the Mithraeum's second most senior officer, the Heliodromus, who represents Sol's part, have a symbolic banquet on the hide of a sacrificed bull, representing the Bull killed in The Tauroctony.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], also a soldier, teach us to die aright!
I feel a complete fool.

It has been decided that [From.GetTitledFirstName] is to represent [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]' part in [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol's banquet scene! [From.GetSheHim] is clad in the same clothes [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] wears in the images: a red Phrygian cap, a red long-sleeved tunic, dark red Parthian trousers and a blue cape. He, and the Mithraeum's second most senior officer, the Heliodromus, who represents Sol's part, have a symbolic banquet on the hide of a sacrificed bull, representing the Bull killed in The Tauroctony..
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], also a soldier, teach us to die aright!
Look at that fool.

You have chosen to represent [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] yourself in the part [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and Sol's banquet scene. You are clad in the same clothes [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] wears in the images: a red Phrygian cap, a red long-sleeved tunic, dark red Parthian trousers and a blue cape. You and the Mithraeum's second most senior officer, the Heliodromus, who represents Sol's part, have a symbolic banquet on the hide of a sacrificed bull, representing the Bull killed in The Tauroctony.

As is custom, the one of the Mithraic senior officers, the Paters, must represent the part of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. You could give this honour to your court's Pater which would be seen both legitimate and prestigious, but  choosing the local MIthraeum's Pater would be much more pious. Alternatively, you can choose to represent [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] yourself, while this might paint you in a grandiose light, the Mithraic officers will not be so happy.
My court's Pater will represent [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]
The local Mithraeum's pater will represent [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
I will represent [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!

As the banquet scene ends, now it's the time to place offerings in [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s altar. The initiates give each one of you a part of the sacrificed bull's entrails, which you burn in a brazier placed on the altar while you start the prayer "Hail to thee [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName], patron of soldiers! I come to thy abode as a Servant of the Light and as a Seeker of Wisdom. I beg thee to aid me in my desire to serve", as the entrails burn, you continue the prayer...
I wear the Armour of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. I am shielded from all that is harmful!
I wield the Weapons of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. No darkness may stand against against them!
I stand in the Light of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. In the Light, I am invincible, for [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] is my crown!
Let us feast together!
Until next time!
A foolish mistake.
I will be there.
I will have nothing to do with that nonsense!

Offerings to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]
The Banquet Scene
The Banquet Scene
Raise an Irminsul

Raise an Irminsul, a wooden pillar carved from an oak's hollow trunk. You can only raise one Irminsul in one of your demesne's province. The Irminsul's presence will surely please the gods and bless your lands.
The craftsmen start the process of carving the oak's hollow trunk into an Irminsul...

You have decided to raise an Irminsul, a wooden pillar dedicated to the divine, made from the hollowed trunk of a sacred oak. Your woodcutter quickly finds a great oak, worthy of praise. It is custom to carve the face of a deity in it, to honour them. Who should be carved into it?
Wodanaz, the Wise One, patron of men
Teiwaz, the patron of war and good governance

You have decided to raise an Irminsul, a wooden pillar dedicated to the divine, made from the hollowed trunk of a sacred oak. Your woodcutter quickly finds a great oak, worthy of praise. You order your workers to move the oak's trunk to the entry of the sacred grove of [Root.Location.GetName], where a delegation of priests silently picks it up and moves it further into the grove...
Let's hope it pleases them...
Raising of the Irminsul

It's great ceremony at [Root.Location.GetName]'s sacred grove and people from all over the land have gathered there to see the Irminsul raised. As [Root.GetTitle] of this people, it is your duty to preside over the ceremony. Your workers raise the Irminsul your craftsmen carved the oak's trunk into. Now, it is a great wooden pillar, carved in interlaced patterns, with all kinds of scenes involving animals and myths carved into it as well. But one carving stands above all others: a sagely face with a long beard, overlooking from the top of the Irminsul all those who have gathered to see the it raised with a fatherly gaze. It's no doubt Wodanaz, father of all.
All praise Wodanaz, the Wise One, father of men!

It's great ceremony at [Root.Location.GetName]'s sacred grove and people from all over the land have gathered there to see the Irminsul raised. As [Root.GetTitle] of this people, it is your duty to preside over the ceremony. Your workers raise the Irminsul your craftsmen carved the oak's trunk into. Now, it is a great wooden pillar, carved in interlaced patterns, with all kinds of scenes involving animals and myths carved into it as well. But one carving stands above all others: a strong face with a stern look and long hair. It's no doubt Teiwaz, lord of war and patron of good governance!
All praise Teiwaz, may he strengthen the hearts of the brave and true!

Months have passed since you gave the oak's trunk to the priests and you have received no news from them, you start wondering if everything went alright. Maybe the priests didn't find your gift worthy of being carved into an Irminsul. You decide to go to [Root.Location.GetName]'s sacred grove and ask them yourselves. When you get to the grove's entry, you find that your arrival was expected, and indeed, all the priests in the grove have come to receive you. Their spokesman greets you: "The oak you offered to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] has been found worthy of being consecrated into an Irminsul, the Gods are grateful" when you inquire further on where it is they tell you: "No mere mortal may look upon the words of power we placed upon it without dire consequences, now be gone, and know that [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] watches over you and the whole of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]."
I'll have to take their word for it...
The Irminsul
Wodanaz's Irminsul
This province houses an Irminsul dedicated to Wodanaz, the Allfather
Teiwaz's Irminsul
This province houses an Irminsul dedicated to Teiwaz, god of war and good governance
Sacred Irminsul
This province houses an Irminsul to be tended and seen exclusively by the Irminsulic priesthood
Sacrifice [Root.GetTitledFirstName] at the Irminsul
Have your priests sacrifice [Root.GetTitledFirstName] in front of the Irminsul. [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will surely be pleased.

You bring [Root.GetTitledName] in front of [From.Location.GetName]'s Irminsul to be sacrificed in honour of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. As the [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], it's your sacred duty have this person sacrificed to [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName], as you put [Root.GetName] to [Root.GetHerHis] knees, he begs of you not to kill him... but it is useless. You place him in a stone alter before the Irminsul and slit his throat, then you take part of his blood with your hands and spray it over the Irminsul
This will please [From.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap].

You bring [Root.GetTitledName] in front of [From.Location.GetName]'s sacred grove to be sacrificed in honour of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. According to Irminsulic rites, only the priests may see the Irminsuls, and only them may offer sacrifices to the gods. Two priest come out of the grove to take [Root.GetName] away for sacrifice at the Irminsul, dressed in a different way from the typical Irminsulic priestly garb. They wear full, white robes, and their faces are tattooed with a ghastly visage, [Root.GetName] begs for his life... but it's useless, he's dragged into the grove by the priests... afterwards, the priest's spokesman notifies you: "Your sacrifice has pleased [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. You have the favour of the divine"
[From.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] is pleased
A carved tree trunk the locals call "Irminsul" has been found in one of your provinces. As a good ruler of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, it is your duty to destroy such an abomination!
The Sacrifice
First I need to consider how much food and drink I will purchase for the Blot, to honour the Gods.
The Gods deserve the best! The cost is irrelevant!
No one shall call us greedy. Spend, but not excessively.
We are on a budget here. Spend just as much as we need.
It is time to tell your vassals of the upcoming blot.
There are other gods...
